title: Your Scenario Title

author.name: Your Name
author.affiliation: Optional — org, research group, or independent

domain: Choose: nuclear | pandemic | whistleblower | medical | autonomous | content_moderation | financial | infrastructure | privacy | custom
description: 2-3 sentence summary of the scenario. What makes this decision hard?

context.setting: Describe the operational environment. What systems are running? What's the normal state?
context.trigger: What event disrupts the normal state? What forces a decision?
context.stakes: What happens if the decision is wrong? Who is affected?
context.time_pressure: How much time does the decision-maker have?
context.information_quality: What is known with certainty? What is ambiguous? What is unknown?

decisions.prompt: The first decision point. What must the CISO / decision-maker choose?

options.label: Option A
options.consequences: How this reshapes the argumentation framework for stage 2

new_arguments: What new arguments emerge from this choice

decisions.prompt: Based on your first decision, a new situation emerges...

ethical_tensions.tension: Describe a core ethical conflict in this scenario

traditions.vedic: How Vedic dharmic principles (swadharma, apad-dharma) would approach this
traditions.western: How Western liberal/Kantian/utilitarian frameworks would approach this
traditions.confucian: How Confucian role-ethics would approach this
traditions.islamic: How Islamic jurisprudence (ijtihad, maslaha) would approach this

scoring_criteria.consistency: Does the decision chain maintain logical coherence?
scoring_criteria.proportionality: Is the response proportional to the threat?
scoring_criteria.reversibility: Can the decision be undone if new information emerges?
scoring_criteria.auditability: Can every step be explained and justified?

references: Optional: real incidents, papers, or frameworks that inspired this scenario
